channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet the 10 CFOs on Fortune’s 2025 Most Powerful Women in business list
item.description: The list features 100 leading businesswomen from finance, tech, health care, telecom, retail, energy, and other industries.

item.title: Fortune’s 2025 Most Powerful Women list is here
item.description: The annual ranking of the women leading global business is more competitive than ever.

item.title: Gavin Newsom’s Shameless Dodge on the Homeless Crisis
item.description: California’s governor tries — and fails — to blame the state’s homelessness epidemic on someone, anyone else.

item.title: Here Are 9 Questions About The Biden White House That Must Be Answered After Cancer Diagnosis
item.description: Acknowledging Biden’s poor health triggers the big question that leads to a major scandal. Who was running the country?

item.title: Musk says he’s committed to being Tesla CEO for next five years
item.description: The Tesla head previously complained of 'great difficulty' jugging his CEO and government advisor jobs.

item.title: Not just ‘slash and burn’—the real reason this major pharmaceutical company ousted 40% of its middle managers
item.description: In an effort to become more nimble, some companies, like Bayer Pharmaceutical, are getting rid of middle managers.

item.title: Home Depot CFO says tariffs won't spur price increases
item.description: Home Depot said Tuesday it does not plan to raise prices because of President Trump's tariffs.

item.title: Sparks expected to fly at high-stakes House hearing on threats against ICE
item.description: The House of Representatives is holding a hearing on threats to operations of Immigrations and Customs Enforcement.

item.title: Maryland's first Black governor blocks reparations bill, disappointing fellow Democrats
item.description: Maryland's Black Democratic Gov. Wes Moore has vetoed a reparations bill that came to his desk, despite supporting reparations in principle.

item.title: Putin Is Playing with Trump
item.description: The master at establishing leverage in negotiations has failed to do so over the president of Russia.

item.title: Excusing Violent Anti-Trump Rhetoric Will Have Terrible Ramifications
item.description: Democrats’ deliberately incendiary rhetoric singles out, demonizes, and dehumanizes Trump as someone who must be eliminated.

item.title: Texas lawmakers seek to get federal reimbursement for Biden-era border control expenses
item.description: The new bill would create funding sources to pay back states for border enforcement actions taken since former President Joe Biden's inauguration.

item.title: The World Health Organization Is Excluding Taiwan — at China’s Behest
item.description: It is time for the WHO to take a more pragmatic and inclusive approach — one that puts public health above politics.

item.title: U.S. to pay out almost $5 million to family of Jan. 6 rioter Ashli Babbitt
item.description: The federal government is expected to pay out about $5 million to the family of Ashli Babbitt to settle a lawsuit brought by her estate.

item.title: Who Is the President Here?
item.description: On Russia and beyond, the VP seems to be signaling policy preferences that do not comport with those of the administration he serves.

item.title: The Biden Diagnosis
item.description: We wish the former president well, but there is nothing untoward or scurrilous about the citizenry asking who knew what — and when.

item.title: Vices, Virtues, and a Little Humor: 30 Quotes from Financial History
item.description: This collection of quotes from US financial history offers timeless lessons in vice, virtue, and investing wisdom for every generation.
